titleStmt.title: Thomas E. Bramlette, Justice of the Peace, William R. Duncan
CWG1816

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
IN THE NAME AND BY THE AUTHORITY OF
The Commonwealth of Kentucky,
KENTUCKY
UNITED WE STAND, DIVIDED WE FALL
THOMAS E. BRAMLETTE,
GOVERNOR OF SAID COMMONWEALTH.
To all whom these Presents shall come, Greeting:

Know Ye, That Wm K. Duncan having been duly Appointed JUSTICE OF THE PEACE, for Hancock County, in District, No 4. until next regular election vice Jas Prentis resigned, I hereby invest him with full power and authority to execute and discharge the duties of the said office according to law: And to have and to hold the same, with all the rights and emoluments thereunto legally appertaining, until his successor is duly qualified according to law.

In Testimony Whereof, I have caused these letters to be made patent and the Seal of the Commonwealth to be hereunto affixed. Done at Frankfort, the 4th day of March, in the year of our Lord, one thousand eight hundred and 64, and in the 72nd year of the Commonwealth.

BY THE GOVERNOR:
E. L. VanWinkle, Secretary of State.
By Jas R. Page
Asst Secty
Commonwealth Office -- WM. E. HUGHES, State Printer.

Wm R Duncan
Commission
Justice Peace
4th Dis. HC
1864. March 14th
filed in clerk's office
noted of record HC

att
Eldred E Rate
clerk H. C. C
This day William R. Duncan appeared and took the several oaths required as Justice of the peace in the Lewisport District March 14th 1864
